text.p: These are the leading stories in the Greek Cypriot press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these reports and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- The United Nations strive for a solution to the Cyprus problem in 1998, and will seek an agreement between the two sides at the next round of talks at Montreaux, Switzerland, for the two communities to proceed with drawing up a constitution for the new federal state.
- Telephone operators at hospitals demand pay rises and threaten to go on strike on July 23.
- President Glafcos Clerides has given a committment he will be present at the next round of talks.
- The United States kept its distance from the U.N. talks. US presidential emissary Richard Holbrooke meets Clerides and Turkish Cypriot leader Rauf Denktash today.
- The cruise business in Cyprus is booming. Six cruise boats sail from Cyprus almost daily for trips in the region.
- The state loses millions of pounds each year from inexcusable delays in carrying out development projects already included in annual budgets.
